highlights.summary:
Established in the year 1997, Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology is picturesque campus located in the bank of river Teesta. SMIT Sikkim offers courses in the field of Engineering, Basic Sciences, Computer Application and Management. SMIT Sikkim is a constituent college of Sikkim Manipal University. Manipal Institute of Technology Sikkim is accredited by NBA and is approved by UGC and AICTE. The college is also ISO certified. SMIT Sikkim offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programmes in different streams in a full-time mode. Admission to all the courses is merit-based or entrance exam score-based. Apart from regular classes, SMIT offers several courses in collaboration with various institutions.
The highest package offered at SMIT Sikkim during 2024 placements was INR 54 LPA. Some of the top recruiters that have visited the SMIT Sikkim campus for placements include Tech Mahindra, Cognizant, Accenture, Jacobs, Amul, Wipro, PwC and Airtel, among others. Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology also offers scholarships to meritorious students. Students can check the major highlights of SMIT Sikkim in the table provided below:

SMIT Sikkim Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, a worthy off-campus view, knowledgeable faculty members, and average placements

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently in my 5th semester of B.Tech (CSE), and the most recent pass-out 2025 batch are placed in reputed companies. In our 5th semester, recently a US healthcare company, Vivnovation, visited offering ₹15,000 per month as an intern role and a PPO of 22 LPA on satisfactory work performance. This year, the 2025 pass-out percentage of students placed stood at 76.5%, with 268 getting placed out of 350. The highest in-campus package offer is by Amazon, PwC, and Microsoft, which are 14 LPA, 12 LPA, and 8 LPA respectively. The roles are SAP Consultant and TS.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms are well-equipped with proper seating arrangements and basic facilities. Every classroom is a smart class (no A/C). The labs are all Wi-Fi enabled with modern computers and architecture (A/C enabled). The library is big, well maintained, and has a large collection of books and reading space. Extra books can be provided on demand. Basic hostel facilities include bed, mattress, pillow, and bathroom items. Every room has average Wi-Fi with 16 Mbps speed. Mess food quality is low and not very nutritious. Medical, sports, gym, and games are well maintained and worth it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers mostly are well qualified and knowledgeable, with good teaching methods, leaving some with a very rigid and boring way of teaching, which, we all can agree, happens in every college. The curriculum needs to be revised with modern subjects, and a big change is required in the first-year syllabus. Semester exams are application-based with good conceptual questions and average evaluation guidelines. There are two midterms of 50 marks summed up into 30, two quizzes of 5 marks each, 5 marks for attendance, 5 for assignment, and a 50-mark end-semester examination.
detailed_review.Other: Well, I got a 40% scholarship on fests due to my JEE rank, and this is a good option to go with for a CSE degree. The professors are okay, and the curriculum is good enough. You get a lot of time to work on your personal skills. Coding culture is too low, that can be worked upon, and clubs mostly begin normally but get lost in interior politics down the line. Fests are okay but can be made far better if the administration actually opens up and looks at things other than just academics. Crowd has increased definitely.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Computer Science (AI and IoT)
reviews.review_title: All-around campus with good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Currently B.Sc. Computer Science (specialized in AI and IoT) is a newly formed branch that comes under the electronics and communication department, and I am the first batch student of this course. Placement is not initiated as we are currently in the second year of this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure and faculty are good. Many facilities are provided by the department as well as the college. We can do whatever project we want to perform, and our department supports our projects and needs. Wi-Fi quality is a bit disappointing on campus, almost everyone uses 5G in college because Jio 5G has very high internet speed on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are well-experienced, we can say more than 10-12 years of experience in teaching. Co-curricular activities took place frequently, where we could showcase multiple talents and take part in various tech-related events. Exams are strict and fair, and there is no chance of cheating or any malpractice.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to take a good course under low fees compared to B.Tech, whose fees are high, and I have an interest in both computer and electronics. By taking this course, I can engage with both of these, which may not have been possible if I had just taken B.Tech in computer science and this. The annual fest is of a flagship level where multiple events take place, and amazing artists come and perform for us. Overall, college is good with decent placement records.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70% of students are placed in B.Tech CSE, which is approximately 100 to 150 students. The highest package for B.Tech CSE is around 25 LPA, and the lowest is around 7 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Dell, Microsoft, Amazon, Flipkart, and many more. Almost all students from the B.Tech CSE department secure jobs and internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: SMIT has six academic blocks, including labs, workshops, a library, and reading rooms. Besides this, it also has two hostels, one for boys and one for girls. The campus includes one ground and a sports block with a swimming facility. The hostel facilities are good, with each room accommodating two students and a floor warden assigned to each floor. The food in the mess is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching faculty members are well-disciplined and well-educated. They have good teaching experience and an effective management system for all students. The course curriculum consists of programming and electrical knowledge, which prepares students well for jobs. Semester exams are not very difficult, and the passing percentage is 35%.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: The college is good, you get good education, and can live a college life.

detailed_review.Placements: The package in our college is like 3 to 4 Lacs per year, which is an average package for a beginner, and it is good to start with it. Many companies offer here, such as HDFC, Occitan, etc. 79 percent of the students get jobs, and they get the post of human resources manager.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good. The college has many buildings and has a playground. All facilities are available. The hostel is also very big the hostel rooms are spacious and hygienic. There is a marina where there is good food and indoor games, a gym, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well educated and qualified. Everyone is friendly, and they teach us very well. No one is late for the classes. The semester exams are tough, and the passing mark is 35%. I think it does not make the students industry-ready, as the college does not take students on industrial visits.
detailed_review.Other: I choose this course because I want to learn about business and start my own business. If there were an industrial visit in our college, it would be better for us to know about the production in industry.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Mathematics
reviews.review_title: I am happy with my decision to join college as it is better than my expectations.

detailed_review.Placements: The college is overall good for me. Students in our batch are less than 15. We usually get offers for internships from the 3rd year. I am currently in my 2nd year, I can't say anything about placements. After completing B.Sc. in mathematics, students get many options in different sectors like business, banking, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides facilities and infrastructure. The whole campus is Wi-Fi enabled. Students can go to the library for studies. Classrooms are well-maintained. There are labs for every department. In the hostel, students get two choices to stay one for single and one for double. Students get a gym, a swimming pool, and an indoor court for basketball and badminton. Students can use an outdoor court as their choice.
detailed_review.Faculty: Lecturers and professors are well-qualified. Teachers in our department are very helpful in both academic and non-academic fields. The rule of exams is that there are 2 semesters every year, and in each semester, 2 sessional exams are conducted for 50 marks, and 2 quizzes are conducted for 10 marks.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B.Sc. math because only a few members graduated in mathematics in my state. I face less number of challenges as there are more opportunities in my state for students to complete graduation in mathematics.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: Overall, the college experience was okay for me. Someone who wants to explore nearby locations.

detailed_review.Placements: From my batch, around 8-10 people were placed, but it was because many people wanted to pursue higher education, and very few companies came with a good job role. The highest package of 7 LPA was offered for BBA. Accenture, PWC, and Uniqlo were the top companies. 2-3 students got internships at Intellipaat (edtech org). Associate software engineer was offered from Accenture.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The course is outdated and many of the PPTs are too old, and the same PPT is used to teach us with a few minor changes. We weren't provided with any industry visits. New teachers were nice and put effort into teaching. The hostel was fine, clean, and well-maintained. The lift was not serviced on a timely basis, but it was okay for me.
detailed_review.Faculty: There were a few faculty members who didn't put much effort into teaching, but on the other hand, there were a few teachers who were really great at their jobs, and I loved attending their lectures. The passing criteria are very easy, and it's easy to score in internals. You won't have to study that hard for exams. We don't get much practical experience or industry exposure.
detailed_review.Other: Personally, I went for the college location, which is very peaceful. They could improve the quality and re-evaluate the course to improve it. To be very honest, the college doesn't encourage the fest, although they do take the credit.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A short summary of Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: There is an average placement of approx 55 percent and the highest package received last year was 54 lakhs per annum by Google. The average package was 6 lakhs per annum, and the top recruits were Amazon, Dell Technologies, Shell, etc. The college has a decent placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Amidst the beautiful valleys of Sikkim, we have this college situated, which provides the perfect ambiance for studies. The hostels are quite decent compared to other colleges, and the main advantage is having personal bathrooms. The quality of food in the mess is also good, where a diverse menu is followed.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are good overall, but the best and most qualified ones are in the Mechanical and Computer Science branches. The classes are engaging and very much application-based, especially the course offered in the CSE department, which is very helpful when it comes to real-world problems. The examination is very good, with a level that is moderate to difficult. The pass percentage would be approximately 60 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college as it provides great education at an affordable fee, and the lustrous green campus and serene and peaceful environment attracted me to join this institute. The overall experience of being a student is great. There are issues of connectivity due to being located in the mountains, but it provides great scholarships and has a great gender ratio where everyone is treated equally, and the surrounding area is also safe for women.

reviews.course: BBA in Business Analytics and Fintech
reviews.review_title: The college is good, but there is no outside life, like no markets or malls.

detailed_review.Placements: Well, I am doing BBA in Fintech, and our batch is the first batch, so I have no idea what percentage of students were placed in our course. However, I have seen in BBA General that many of the seniors were placed, with about 70-80% of them securing jobs. To achieve that, you need to maintain your CGPA above 7.5 and take some courses for better offers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Honestly, the facilities and infrastructure available in this college are very nice. The whole campus has Wi-Fi, there are 4-5 lab rooms, and the classrooms are also very nice. There is a library with a reading hall, and it is quite spacious and air-conditioned. Regarding the hostel, they provide a night canteen. The quality of food in the mess is quite good; you can eat there, and they serve different meals each day. They have a weekly meal chart, and there is a dispensary for any medical issues. In terms of sports, we have a marina that includes a gym, basketball court, badminton court, and swimming facilities, so hostel life is very nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They teach politely and gently. They do try to make students industry-ready, but it ultimately depends on the students; if they don’t want to engage, it’s quite impossible. Regarding exams, the structure here is good. There are five exams in total: two quizzes, two sessionals, and a semester exam. The quizzes are worth five marks, sessionals are 15 marks each, and the semester exam is 50 marks. The remaining 10 marks come from five marks for attendance and five marks for assignments.
detailed_review.Other: My batch is the first one, consisting of only 15 students, and they are very nice and helpful. I chose this college because I was interested in BBA, and I saw that they offered a BBA in Fintech. I thought that a regular BBA wouldn’t be as helpful in the future, so I opted for BBA Fintech for better career prospects. I think they can improve by providing more fintech and business analytics subjects in the early semesters. For events, we have 2-3 yearly events, with Kaalrav being the biggest fest in Sikkim.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life at Smit - an experience.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at SMIT are quite good with 80 percent of students getting placed. The highest package offered was 90 LPA, the lowest was 5 LPA and the average package was 10 LPA. Many well-known companies visit the campus for placements including Amazon, TCS, Myntra, Tata, Ola and Byju's. Almost everyone gets an internship, and top roles offered include front-end developer and editor.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms at SMIT are big, wide, and spacious, and they are also clean. The Wi-Fi is very fast. The library is chilled and spacious, and it offers a large range of books, from mathematics to chemistry to physics. Many project files and research papers are also available, along with an e-library.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were friendly and helpful, and the curriculum was relevant and prepared me for the industry. The exams were moderate to hard, and the pass percentage was around 60%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to be a good engineer and help in the nation's development. SMIT has a lot of events and festivals, including Kaalrav, the biggest college fest. Extracurricular activities also take place from time to time. There are a variety of scholarships you can apply for, including sports, JEE, merit, and EWS.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the college in terms of faculty and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is provided by the college in fields like HR, marketing and finance. Most of the placements are for sales. There is also a tie-up between the college and reputed companies with a good package, providing a great start to a career and future growth potential for students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facility provided in terms of infrastructure and course is great overall, equipped with industry-demand course curriculum. They provide facilities for a digital library and good internet connectivity. The food provided is decent for students from different regions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were helpful and they were knowledgeable about their teaching processes. This course is curriculum relevant and it does make students industry-ready. Exams are tough but one can pass them by preparing thoroughly and the pass percentage is 97 to 98 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I wanted to enhance my leadership skills by preparing for management role to be future-ready. More co-curricular activities should be added, like sports activities. College fest is the biggest of all in Northeast. There are scholarship based on competitive exam marks, state quotas, etc.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Education in the mountains.

detailed_review.Placements: The college offers a lot in placements assistance. There are various companies visiting the college to recruit the students such as TCS, Infosys, Wipro, DELL and many others. The average package offered in this course is 4 Lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Courses available in the college consist of skill-based subjects which make the students work hard to excel in every field. The topics which are covered in this course are up to the mark. Hostel life here is also very exciting with a strong Wi-Fi connection and continuous supply of electricity and water.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty present in the college is too good as they have a lot of knowledge. Faculty members here strive for excellence of the students and work hard to make every student learn at their best. Exams are regularly conducted so that no students lag behind.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely amazing and worth remembering experience.

detailed_review.Placements:
Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology has shown close to 100% placements each year.
The highest package goes as high as 25–28 LPA.
The top recruiting companies of the institute are Accenture, Microsoft, Dell, Bosch, Shell, etc.
Overall, the college has shown a promising placement record in the past few years.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The hostel at SMIT, like any other college, is pretty decent. It has Wi-Fi facilities not just inside the hostel but throughout the entire campus.
The hostel rooms are of 4 different types: double- or single-room, with or without AC, and have facilities like a sports gym, a medical service, library and different kinds of workshops and laboratories.
detailed_review.Faculty:
The academics at SMIT are managed by highly qualified professors at Sikkim Manipal University. Each semester, there are two different kinds of examinations: quizzes 1 and 2, and sessional 1 and 2, which also include assignments and lab sessions.
Each semester is neither easy nor hard to crack; it totally depends on the students.
detailed_review.Other:
The students joining SMIT should be aware of what is wrong and what is right. Every one or two years, the college organizes the biggest cultural fest in north-east India, known as Kaalrav.
And there are a number other non-curricular and extracurricular activities conducted by the college itself.
Overall, Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology is definitely a good choice for newcomers and freshers to join the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Short and honest review of my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is approximately 80% for all the courses. The highest package offered was 29 LPA. According to place and student potential, placement is okay; if you work hard, you will definitely get a good package. The good thing about here is the crowd is not much.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: According to the hills, infrastructure is quite good. Hostels are far better than the other colleges. There is a well-maintained library and a separate reading hall for students. Wi-Fi connection is very bad; you have to use your own data. Labs are okay.
detailed_review.Faculty: There is too much load of exams after every 20 days. There is an exam for every 20 days. The full semester is divided into 2 quizzes, 2 seasonal exams, 1 lab exam, and 1 final semester exam. Courses are not that tough if you will be regular. 1 semester is of approximately 22 credits.
detailed_review.Other: there is a huge drug culture.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Total experience and review by an ex student.

detailed_review.Placements: The Computer Science branch in our college has the highest placement rate compared to other branches. The placement for Computer Science is excellent, while civil, mechanical, and electrical branches have relatively poor placement. However, many teaching companies also come for placement in the CS branch. CS students have the highest placement rate in the college, standing at 97%.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel provides Wi-Fi, along with various facilities such as classrooms, playgrounds for cricket and football, a complex with a gym, snooker, table tennis, basketball court, auditorium, and a food court. Additionally, there is a swimming pool, amphitheater hall, court, library with a stationary shop, and a dispensary for health issues.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers lack helpfulness, but the course is highly relevant and regularly updated with industry-ready skills. Although the semester exams are challenging, with proper studying, passing them becomes manageable. However, the teaching proficiency and fluency of the faculty are questionable, and there is a noticeable bias and disappointing lack of care for students' needs. The overall quality of teaching is superb.
detailed_review.Other: During holidays, college can be quite dull as there are limited nearby options for entertainment and relaxation. To truly enjoy yourself, you would have to travel to Gangtok, which is approximately 40 kilometers away. Additionally, there are numerous insects at night and a nearby river that can be dangerous during periods of high water flow.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Why you should not come to SMIT by a 2023 CSE passout!

detailed_review.Placements: Placements have taken a hit after COVID. Earlier, Microsoft used to hire properly. In 2023 and 2024 that did not happen. Only interns who had done their summer internship were given ppo. Even the internship process itself was shady. I had a CGPA of 9.7 when Microsoft came and the college only allowed the top 30 students to submit their resumes. I was able to submit my resume but after that, I do not know what happened and only five students were randomly selected. Even their resumes were not that good. Same with the biggest company, Commvault, from whom mysteriously the names of several students were struck off. The college passed it off as company shortlisting but everybody knows what it is. No doubt no one was hired by Commvault and it subsequently banned SMIT, as far as I got to know. The TNP is very shady, bringing totally worthless companies offering a mere package of even 2.75 LPA with ~ 2 years of bond. The placement states are poor; they look, this is a tier-3 college. No doubt bringing companies is something I understand but why hide things? I can go on writing so much more about this but the result will be the same. I hope somebody needs to read this. If placement is the sole criteria, please do not come here. Manipal Jaipur, Chandigarh University, Amity Noida, and LPU are some good options for those who have messed up Main. I am writing this anonymously because I am afraid that the college administration will find me out. But trust me when I say that all the above points I mentioned are true.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I have not been to other hostels but it is decent here; there is no major complaint as such. Plus, the students here make it really vibrant. If you enjoy late-night stuff, the hostel is good in that regard. The course I had taken was B.Teach in CSE. Very outdated, and the faculty is too disinterested to teach. Some of them are good; others are really bad. They might be knowledgeable, as I had mentioned but there is a difference between being knowledgeable and being a good teacher. 3 stars just for the hostel and physical infrastructure.
detailed_review.Faculty: The good faculty members have mostly left. I do not mean to dishonor any teacher but many of them are full of ego. especially the ones sitting at the top. They might be very knowledgeable, having published so many research papers but they do not know how to impart that knowledge. One thing I would like to mention is that teachers are approachable. They will try their best to make you understand. Many of them are friendly as well and will try their best to help you, even on a personal level. But everything gets turned down because of the placement, poor management, and some egoistic teachers sitting at the top as heads of respective departments. The Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics department teachers are by far the best and most knowledgeable of the lot. The syllabus is outdated, in my frank opinion but I think that is the case with every tier-3 college. You need to explore things on your own, outside of college studies, to grow.
detailed_review.Other: Whatever I will be mentioning here will be absolutely true. As I mentioned, I am writing this anonymously so that the college does not figure me out. Not that I care if they figure it out but I still would like to keep my identity hidden. If you enjoy changing around and do not care anything about your career, then SMIT is just that. Fests and events are less than what they used to be in pre-covid times but the crowd here is fun-loving. Drinks, parties, strong friendships, fights, and romance—expect every bit of this. College is pretty hilly in these aspects. But if you are looking for placement, it is not good. I do not want to use harsh words but I will say this much: the college management has itself messed up everything. Companies cracked by students off-campus are shown as on-campus placements. Amazon has never come to this college. So is WatchGuard and that 36.5 LPA package you see. The only big branded companies that have ever come are Microsoft, Commvault, and Providence. College is little lenient if you have problem with If you are not getting any good colleges, I will recommend a few, and please trust me with this again. I have been at your place and know exactly what I should have done. Go to Manipal Jaipur, Chandigarh University, Amity Nodia, LPU, TIET, and MAIT. Trust me, these are way better than this college. One more thing to those people from my college who are outraged by this writing: I have written only the truth. Things that I could not say back in college due to fear of you people withholding my degree. I was one of the best in college but I am really ashamed of this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely a value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, the placement rate is above 80%. Good companies like Tata, Google, Amazon, etc. come to me for good opportunities. But you have to work hard to achieve your goals. Our faculty members are always there for you if you need any kind of help.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I used to stay in hostels. Or believe me or not, your hostel life will be the most precious memory you will get from SMIT. Infrastructure is very safe and beautiful. Cleaning staff do their work properly to provide you with a clean and healthy environment.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are the best mentors you will ever get in your life. They are helpful, qualified, knowledgeable, and very good at teaching. They will help you in every way to get you ready for the upcoming world. If you focus on your studies, nothing is holding you back from passing the examination.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college, in general, is a good college.

detailed_review.Placements: SMIT doesn't have placements for civil engineering at all. Not even a single batchmate of mine got placement. It does have a good placement percentage for computer engineering students as the placement percentage is 96%. Other departments have a good placement rate too.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is what makes joining this college reasonable. SMIT is one of the best colleges and also have the best infrastructure, better than most of the college in Sikkim. It has a huge vicinity and an amazing sports facility too. Hostel is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is moderate but better than other Bachelor colleges in Sikkim. Teachers are very helpful and the way they approach academically is impeccable too. The course curriculum is relevant but not upto the mark for students who plan to sit for all India exams.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Excellent infrastructure, well experienced faculty & one of the best learning environment in India.

detailed_review.Placements: SMIT had a dedicated TNP cell that works tirelessly in terms of arranging the hiring programmes and giving pre-placement training to students as well. From my course,  65 per cent of students were placed. The annual package varied from 6-8 LPA. Some of the top recruiting companies were Cognizant, EY, Intellipat, Talview, Dell, Next and many more. Microsoft has been consistently offering top roles with excellent packages of around 20-25 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is well known for its peaceful and learning-friendly environment on the banks of river teesta with less crowd as well as pollution. The classrooms are well-equipped with smart televisions, Every student gets 90GB of Wi-Fi package per month. The labs like Computer Applications Lab, Advanced Programming Lab, Super Computing Lab, and Central Computing Facility, are well-equipped will all the modern hardware required for quality education. The hostel rooms are well maintained and cleaned regularly. There are a total of 4 messes. 2-2 each in senior girls and boys' hostels. They provide 4 times of healthy and nutritious foods.
detailed_review.Faculty: Undoubtedly, SMIT provides one of the best education in India. Aligning with the latest trends in terms of Techno, the curriculum is updated frequently. The faculty members are more like parents providing all sorts of assistance in terms of Academics and well as non-academic matters. Along with the course curriculum, every department organizes numerous workshops, industrial visits and seminars to make the student's industry ready. The exams are divided into internal and external exams where the internal exams comprise quizzes, sessional exams, assignments and attendance.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: SMIT ,in my years, was a good experience. I have learnt a lot in this college.

detailed_review.Placements:
In the college there is100% placement in CSE Branch. Top recruiting companies are Dell, Microsoft, Cognizant, Providence, Ericson, Nomura Fintech, etc. 
Top roles offered are in software development, software testing, HR, UI/UX designer, etc. The highest package offered is of INR 25 LPA and the lowest package is of INR 4 LPA. 
95% of the students got internships as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure is good. You will get peaceful and silent environment. Course is great and Wi-Fi is normal. The library  here is the best. Hostel quality is average just like any other college/university. It has a canteen known as mareena which has good quality  food which makes sure that atleast you don't have to sleep on an empty stomach.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is also good and exams are of great level which makes students competitive. It makes students industry ready. You will pass, if you study every day. Don't bother about the percentage, if you focus on studying everyday, you will get good marks. If you are studying just before the exam, you will be able to pass the exams but with average marks.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really great fest and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: 95% placements took place in the college. Great opportunities are offered to each and every student. The packages depends on the course and skills of students. The highest package offered was 24 lakhs per annum.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: No words for infrastructure as everything is so awesome. All the necessary required facilities are provided from gym to swimming pool. Hostel and mess food are literally awesome compared to other colleges. This college is one of the best college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are awesome as they interact with us like friends. They know how to teach and treat students.
detailed_review.Other: Fest is the best part of SMIT. Everyone enjoys a lot as celebrities are also called during the fest.

college_info.college_name: SMIT Sikkim Admission 2025: Eligibility, Process, Courses & Fee

faqs.question: How do I get into SMIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: To get admission into SMIT Sikkim, first check the eligibility criteria for your desired course because some of the admissions are based on merit and others entrance-based. Apply online through the official website of Sikkim Manipal University. The applications are usually opened in November. Candidates are shortlisted based on scores obtained in national-level entrance exams like JEE Main, NET, CAT, or MAT. For those candidates who do not have scores from such exams, SMIT conducts its entrance exam. In addition to GDPI, an MBA aspirant has to go through Group Discussion and Personal Interview. On getting shortlisted, they have to pay the admission fee to reserve the seat.

faqs.question: Can I get admission in SMIT Sikkim for B.Tech with 60% in Class 12th?
faqs.answer: Yes a student can apply and get admission in SMIT Sikkim with 60% marks in class 12th, as the minimum marks for admission is 45% in 12th. The following data is from SMIT Sikkim Official website:-

faqs.question: What is the procedure to take B.Tech admission at Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Admission to SMIT Sikkim 2025 is based on merit and entrance exam scores. The SMET test scores are used to determine admission to most programmes at SMIT Sikkim. Admission to SMIT College for B.Tech is based on the JEE/MET/SMIT Online Test. SMIT Sikkim offers four undergraduate and four graduate courses. Engineering, Science, Computer Applications, and Management are among the courses available. SMET / JEE Main / MET / GATE / CAT / MAT / CMAT are the entrance examinations approved for SMIT Sikkim admission. Admission to Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology is based on passing the most recent qualifying examination in the relevant field. Students must also take entrance examinations, which are followed by counseling and interview processes.

faqs.question: How many students can do B.Tech at SMIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: The Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology (SMIT) offers 180 seats for the Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech.) in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE). SMIT also offers 60 seats for the B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning). SMIT is a technology and management institute with over 3,200 students and 220 faculty members. The campus is spread across 35 acres. SMIT offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and lateral entry programs in various disciplines, including engineering, basic sciences, computer application, and management.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission in Sikkim Manipal University MBA course?
faqs.answer: Sikkim Manipal University only accepts entrance exam scores for admission to the MBA course along with the basic qualification for the management course. National-level exams such as CAT and MAT are accepted by the university. However, students can opt for the University Entrance Test to get shortlisted for the MBA course . SMIT Online Test 2024 Counselling is mandatory for students to participate to finalise their seats. Further, candidates' performance in group discussions and interviews is also considered for final admission. Eligibility Criteria : Bachelor's degree in any discipline with 50% aggregate (45% for Reserved Category).

summary: Sikkim Manipal University has achieved 85% placements in the academic year 2023-2024. The highest and average package offered during SMIT placement 2024 stood at INR 54 LPA and INR 6.48 LPA, respectively. The top recruiters of Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology include Accenture, Mu Sigma, IBM, Bosch, EY, Cognizant, Amazon, ICICI Bank, Axis Bank, Daikin, Amul, Dell, etc.

Silicon Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure but not enough for students doing engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: We have just passed the 1st year now, but the placement rate is average in Silicon, to be honest. The highest package is 37 LPA, and the lowest is 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies like Infosys, Cognizant, Wipro, etc. Many students from the college got good internships, like in local companies as well as in Amazon and Flipkart.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is given in labs and classrooms but not in hostels. Library and lawn everywhere Wi-Fi is there. AC classrooms are there with Wi-Fi. All amenities are given in the hostel but not the Wi-Fi. Students are facing many problems due to this only. Study hour is maintained inside the campus, for which, from 6 to 9, no student is allowed to roam outside.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very good, cooperative, and understanding. Internships as well as courses are making us industry-ready. Questions really are not that hard but not easy, like it's a good question set. Questions are not really tough for students who actually study, but for those who don't, actually.
detailed_review.Other: The CSE branch of Silicon is famous for its placement and package, so I chose it. It would be better if Wi-Fi were given to hostels because students have to move to either the library or the lawn to access it. Connectivity between students is good, and the seniors are helpful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure of hostels and classrooms, and clean surroundings.

detailed_review.Placements:
70 to 80% placement 
Package 8 Lack to 24 Lack per annum and many of the companies like wipro tata naada and may other companies you can attend the seminars ehich give you some brief information about the company and you will able to get the information what things you are going to face un future.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are very good and you can enjoy a lot. Free Wi-Fi is also available, and you can gain a lot of knowledge. The library is also there, which is a very peaceful and silent place where you can read books, and there are many magazines, so you can learn a lot.
detailed_review.Faculty: 40% is the pass percentage, and papers are not much tougher. You can score with little effort; you can get handwritten notes from the seniors, and you can clarify your doubts, too. There are some optional subjects and some credit subjects. I prefer to focus more on credit subjects.
detailed_review.Other: Many events take place, and you can take part. There are also cash prizes available.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Strict about academics and good placement record.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students got placed last year. The average package was 5–6 LPA. After every semester, a summer internship is compulsory for every student. An aggregate of 8 CGPA is needed to sit for placements. The level of exams is moderate. Some top recruiters are TCS, Wipro, Accenture, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is small, and the infrastructure is good according to the campus size. Hostel rooms are clean and spacious.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and very helpful and cooperative. The teaching quality is good. The mid-term is conducted before the end-term, which is of 20 marks. Then the end-term is conducted, which is 50 marks. There are 10 marks for attendance and 20 marks for teacher assessment, making a total of 100 marks.
detailed_review.Other: Two events (fests) are held throughout the year one is Zygon during February-March, and another is Rhythm Nova during November-December. Many seminars and club-related interactions are done. There are many engaging clubs. Many clubs are there, such as the Mera Academics Club, Switch Club, IEEE Club, Robotics Club, and Creative Club. Many activities are arranged for students on a daily basis.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of faculty and good placements from 2019, but not good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement percentage is 75-80%. They secured job offers. The salary packages varied from year to year. The highest package till now is 32.5 LPA. The average package is 5.16 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Accenture, Capgemini, Amazon, DXC Technology, Deloitte, Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, and IBM. 272 internship offers were made, with a stipend ranging from Rs. 8,000 - 60,000 per month.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no Wi-Fi in the hostel but in some classrooms it is available. Hostel has AC and also non-AC rooms, a water cooler, washing machines, network routers, water heaters, etc. The quality of the mess and canteen food is not the best but good compared to other colleges. Doctors are available in the hostel for 1-2 days per week. Badminton courts are available in all hostels and other courts are available outside the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are so helpful and friendly. The best part of this college is they provide excellent teaching experience with their faculty members. They teach us from the beginning and clear out fundamentals. Semester exams are not so hard. If you clear your fundamentals and study for 1-2 hours minimum every day, you can easily crack it. The pass percentage is 80-85%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it has a good placement percentage. There are not so many large events in this college because of less infrastructure areas but some events are organised like Rythm Nova, Zygon, New Year, Diwali, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: The disciplined environment and focus on students.

detailed_review.Placements:
Placements for the EEE department are exceptionally fabulous, with a 
100 percent placement rate. SIT has a strong track record of placements, with a significant percentage of students securing positions in reputable companies annually. Top recruiters include TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Mindtree and Byju's. The average package ranges from 5 to 6 LPA with the highest packages reaching up to 32 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Great infrastructure, with advanced equipment available for students in every laboratory. Hostels provide clean and hygienic food and washroom facilities. Our food menu is decided by students which is an extraordinary feature for students of Silicon. The campus is equipped with high-speed Wi-Fi. Hostels provide comfortable accommodation with necessary amenities. However, some students have suggested improvements in medical facilities and food quality in the mess and canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Great course structure with qualified professors. The course structure helps students overcome any challenges in their corporate or core job. The curriculum is designed to be relevant and industry-oriented and prepare students effectively for their professional careers.
detailed_review.Other: A student-friendly campus where ragging is not allowed for juniors. Teachers are available on Saturdays to clear doubts and give special attention to students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: As I invested more so, I got that much more. That is a placement that everyone needs.

detailed_review.Placements: In my previous batch, the strength of the overall batch was 400, and more than half students in the final year got placed very early, with very few left for placements. In my batch, there are 500 students, and now only 200 are left for placements. Definitely, by the end of the college year, all of them will be placed, as the placement record of our college is very good. 80% of students get placed in our batch. The highest package offered is 15 LPA, and the lowest is 3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is very good. Well-equipped classrooms and labs are there for us. Each classroom has Wi-Fi installed, so there are no interruptions in the network. The library area is very calm and a proper environment for studying, with AC and non-AC rooms available as per the needs of students, along with Wi-Fi. Our hostels, for both boys and girls, have clean and hygienic rooms, corridors, and washrooms. Water and electricity are available 24/7. A lift is also installed, as the top floors are there.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members of our college are very good with their knowledge. They teach students in the most efficient and productive way one can understand. They are keen to solve our queries and doubts. The course curriculum is relevant to what I have studied and what other colleges teach. Semester exams are tough but easy to clear if one studies by heart. The passing criteria is 40 percent overall.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because, as of now, doing engineering is the only thing for a student interested in computer science. All of my cousins have done engineering, so I did too. Though I couldn't opt for the CSE branch, I am very happy with my electronics branch because faculty members I have are the best, and they teach to the best of their knowledge. One thing I can improve is making the best use of the lab provided to us, as it teaches us practically and makes us understand more.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college life at Silicon university.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement record of our college is really good. Most of the MNCs visit our college for the recruitment process such as Accenture, Deloitte Capgemini, Cognizant, etc. The average package is around Rs. 50,000. In the 2023 batch, almost 83% of students got placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has nice infrastructure but the campus is \small or else the campus environment is so good. We have a central library and a Skylab where students can access free Wi-Fi. We have different academic buildings for computer science and engineering, electronics and communication engineering, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are really good and supportive. They support students in every situation and guide them like their parents do. The college conducts 2 exams each semester one is mid-semester of 25 marks and then the end-semester of 60 Marks. The difficulty level is moderate.
detailed_review.Other: I got a spot admission at Silicon University in electronics and communication engineering through the JEE Main rank. My experience in this course is amazing. The faculty members of my branch are supportive and helpful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, facilities, and studies.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students who get placed every year is quite good. Around 80% of students get placed every year. The highest package offered is 33 LPA. Companies like Capgemini, Infosys, TCS, CAMS, and Wipro are top recruiting companies. Courses offered are B.Tech, M.Tech, IMCA, MBA, MCA, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are quite good. Hostel facilities are amazing, as many of my friends live in the hostel. The college organizes many events and sports for students to participate in and gain knowledge from. Wi-Fi is available all over the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Semester exams are not too tough because whatever is taught if you pay attention, then you can do miracles in your semester exams. Seniors are also helpful in providing notes.
detailed_review.Other: I chose ECE because I am much more interested in making my career in VLSI embedded systems and nanotechnology. This branch provides a lot of opportunities to make your career. Many events are conducted for students to take part in, and it can be helpful during your interviews too.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Silicon University - Do join for studies and memories.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is going better compared to 2024, with mass hiring companies like Deloitte, Infosys, and Cognizant visiting. The lowest package offered is 3.6 LPA, the average is 4.5 LPA, and the highest has gone up to 17.5 LPA for now. However, another 3 months are left from February to May, so these may differ. Out of around 800 students, almost 300 secured internships. Roles usually are for Software Development or Full Stack Engineers, and sometimes for Machine Learning Engineers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no Wi-Fi in the hostel, but it is available in the library, some classrooms, and Skylab. Food is average in the hostel. There are great opportunities for sports and games. College also has medical facilities. If you don't wish to eat in the canteen you can eat at the cafeteria.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified. The course curriculum is designed for industrial studies and helps a lot in interviews. College exams are of average difficulty. You can study using PDFs provided by subject teachers and can also ask your teachers to provide important questions.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I wanted to study Computer Science and I have a keen interest in coding. There are several events like technical and cultural fests, quiz contests, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Silicon Institute is a good institute with a comfortable environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. If we score more than 8.5 CGPA and give a good interview then we can get placed in a good company. 70% of students get placed in our course. The highest package is 15 LPA and sometimes it goes up to 20 LPA in a year. Companies like Tata, Jindal, and many IT companies visit the college for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel structure is pretty good with a lot of facilities like a gym, sports ground, etc. There are two types of hostels, One is AC and the other one is non-AC, and we can choose as we like. Wi-Fi is available everywhere and we can access it. Labs are quite good with well-managed desks and chairs. We can run our computer there. Classrooms are neat and clean. In the summer season, we get AC classrooms. Labs are good and have every equipment we need.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are quite good. They are very supportive. Whenever we need their help in our studies, they always help us without any questions. We have different activities in our college like sports, speeches, etc. Exams are very strict here. Courses are practical and here we can read different types of courses like fundamentals management, yoga, and English lab, which makes us well-disciplined people. Semester exams are not difficult if we are studying properly. If we give a minimum of 2-3 hours daily after attending college, then we get a good CGPA.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: A great place to learn about life, and you will grow as a human in this place.

detailed_review.Placements: 65-70% of students got placed. The highest package ranges from 7 LPA - 8 LPA. The lowest package was 3 LPA. The average package was 5 LPA. Top recruitment company was Micron. Top role offered was instrumentation engineer in VLSI companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything was available. Facilities were good. Hostel rooms were good, and you will enjoy them. Sports complex was there, focus on studies, and everything else was gonna be alright. Gym and other amenities were also available. Go for it, and it was worth it. I would recommend this to everyone. Sports were good and other clubs were nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Teaching quality was great as well. Course was relevant for industry-focused and was updated regularly. Semester exams were a bit difficult in comparison but make you industry-ready. I would suggest, go for it. Seniors were really good teachers. They could have been better but okay.
detailed_review.Other: EIE was a better department as less students were there. There were less people so less competition and this department was also suitable for GATE exams. Events and fests were great. Scholarships were also available. Our campus had peaceful surroundings with huge greenery.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: An amazing university where career is crafted.

detailed_review.Placements: Above 90% of the students were placed in good companies in my course last year. The average package is somewhere between 3.5 LPA to 4 LPA. TCS is the highest recruiter. Internships are also done in multiple companies like BSNL, other telecom companies, and other big and small companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has a nice infrastructure with Wi-Fi connectivity throughout the campus and smart labs. Classrooms are also great in every aspect. College has a big common library for the students where there are various books to read and to do research about.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are helpful, highly qualified, and knowledgeable about their respective fields of study. We have an excellent teaching quality. Exams are competitive and require study and hardwork to pass the semester exams. The pass percentage is around 99%.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course as I have a high interest in this field. Events are organized here regularly to reduce academic pressure and live an amazing campus life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Silicon University: A comprehensive review of education and campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: The course is structured to provide both solid theoretical and practical skills that are essential in the field of engineering. Silicon University offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses. In last year, 84% of students were placed with good CTC. The average salary was around 5 LPA. The highest was around 32 LPA. Top recruiters were Infosys, Capgemini, DXC, Wipro, Flipkart, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of Silicon is modern and as per the needs of students. Campus has labs in various engineering departments. Classrooms are spacious. There is a dedicated exam hall, training hall, skill development, and many more. The college library is well stocked by good collection of books, research papers, and journals. Free Wi-Fi is available on campus. Two canteens, serving vegetarian and non-vegetarian food, and one cafeteria are available on campus. Food quality is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in college are highly qualified and experienced in many fields and industries. The teaching methodology in college is a blend of traditional lectures, practical sessions, and interactive sessions ensuring students understand theoretical and practical application. There are two exams in a semester, which makes it easy to score good marks. Passing percentage is 40 %. Professors are knowledgeable and good.
detailed_review.Other: Silicon University is known for its strong academic framework and provides a comprehensive curriculum that prepares students for demands of industry. College offers various UG and PG courses such as B.Tech, M.Tech, and I-MCA. Odisha's top tech fest NIRMAN is conducted by Silicon. Park Up Summit is organized to promote entrepreneurship. Zygon was the top fest in college. It was organized in February by the Silicon student council.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, facility and studies.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed at Silicon is quite good. Around 86% of students get placed. The highest package offered last year was 32 LPA. Many companies, like Deloitte, Infosys, and Capgemini, are the top recruiting companies in the college. The courses offered are B. Tech, IMCA, MCA, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure are excellent in the college. I think it lacks medical facilities; other than that, it is amazing. The facilities in the hostel are amazing, but the quality of food available in the mess and canteen can be improved. The infrastructure for sports and games is very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable too. They are very keen on teaching the students the best only. The course curriculum is very relevant. The semester exams are not too tough. The pass percentage for every subject is different, but seeing the placement rates, the pass percentage is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is a very good place to groom a person and bring the best out of them to build a future.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 80% of students were placed in the EEE branch of my university. The highest package offered was 33 LPA and the average ongoing was around 10 LPA. Some of the top recruiting companies were Wipro, Amazon, TCS, Infosys, Tech Mahindra, SAP Labs, Capgemini, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms comprise both air-conditioned and non-air-conditioned rooms with projectors. The library is quite spacious and has cubicle seating along with discussion rooms for group discussions. More than 50 laboratories are available along with free Wi-Fi in almost all regions. The hostel has both AC and non-AC rooms and separate veg and non-veg canteens for food, along with four dining halls.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are very well-qualified and are very interactive and approachable. The method of teaching is very captivating. This course is very future-friendly and sets the students' industry pace at a high level. The exams are conducted in a very well-mannered and disciplined system that makes one capable of future endeavors.
detailed_review.Other: Also, there are many clubs that would enhance the knowledge of a student.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: 80 percent of students are placed in my department. The highest package is almost 28 Lacs per annum, and the average package is 4.5 Lacs per annum. Top recruiting companies are HP, Accenture, Infosys, Mindtree, Go Digit, etc. Many companies come with internship opportunities, like Haber, Mindfire, Aptus Data Labs, etc. Top roles offered are Software Developer Intern, Web Developer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities available are quite good. The library is available with discussion rooms and a reading area. There are lecture halls with AC facilities. The hostels have attached balconies in each room. There is cleanliness in the hostel as well as in the campus. Wi-Fi is available in Skylab and the library but not in the hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are good, helpful, and well-educated. They are punctual and serious regarding the classes. The classes are conducted on time, and the syllabus is covered timely. The exam pattern is good, with mid-sem exams of 25 marks and end-sem exams of 60 marks. The pass percentage is 80.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of the placement opportunities the college provides. The improvement required is in terms of space; there is little space to hang out with friends. Zygon is the annual fest held, with many other fests conducted by respective clubs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Silicon University - B.Tech college with good ROI.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost every year, 90% of students in the Computer Science department are placed. The placement cell is fairly active. Core companies also visit the campus for electrical and electronics students. The companies like HP, Infosys, Accenture, Mindtree, SAP Labs, and Deloitte visit.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a dedicated space where high-speed Wi-Fi is available on the campus. Labs and the library have Wi-Fi facilities. The amenities in the hostel are pretty decent. The quality of the food in the college canteen is pretty average. The hostel rooms are always clean. Every room is attached to a balcony. The washrooms are always clean, and staff are available in the hostel till 7 PM to clean the washrooms continuously. The classrooms are equipped with smart class facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The academics are very strict in Silicon University. The faculty is punctual to the class, and the classes are conducted regularly. It is moderately difficult to pass the semester exams as the students are supposed to make notes and study, and the college does not allow any malpractices to pass the exams.
detailed_review.Other: The college has good ROI for B.Tech. The improvement needed in the college is regarding the space which the college occupies. Events such as the annual fest Zygon are organised.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The PDEU SOT Review by SOT Student.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. If students work hard, they get good placements. Suppose there are 1,000 students in the first year. By the time they reach their fourth year, there will be around 700 students remaining. The highest salary package offered is 35 LPA. The average salary package offered is 4 LPA. Almost 70% of students got placements. The top recruiting company is Silicon. It is recognized for its consistency in placements among engineering institutes in Odisha. More than 70% of students get placed every year. Around 50% of students get placed with an average compensation of more than 5 LPA. The number of students with paid internships increases every year. The highest stipend offered is Rs. 60,000 per month in 2024. Top companies in product development, startups, and IT services from diverse sectors recruit Silicon students. Some of the notable recruiters from the past three years are Accenture, Adani Group, Aptus Data Labs, Capgemini, Cognizant, Cozentus, CoreEL Technologies, Deloitte, DeepSource, Genpact, IBM, Infosys, Innoware, Jindal Group, LTTS, MentorGraphics, Micron Technology, Mindtree, Mindfire Solutions, Pcon Utilities, Prodapt, PwC, SAP Labs, Scaledge, Surya Digital, Spikewell, TCS, Tata Power, ValueLabs, Vodafone Idea, and Work.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The lab is average because all the equipment is a little old. Around 80% of the equipment is working. Classrooms are good. Around 60% of classrooms have air conditioners. About 40 classrooms do not have air conditioners. The campus is very small. Classrooms have projectors. Wi-Fi is not available everywhere, but it is available in limited areas.The library is available. Some labs and classrooms are average. The hostel is average because there is no Wi-Fi. They maintain it very well. The security system is very good. They are very helpful to us. The food quality is good. The canteen is also good. There is a doctor available in the evening. If students want medicine, they have to go out of the campus. Sports are very good. Students get leather courts. There are 2 basketball courts, two badminton courts, one volleyball court, and two indoor courts. There are badminton courts inside the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable. The teaching should cover both theory and practicals. It should be interesting. Different teaching methodologies like lectures, case studies, project work, etc., should be provided. Assessments at regular intervals are held to understand the progress. The curriculum should be in sync with the current industry requirements and the latest technological advancements. Outdated courses would not help students perform well in today's job scenarios. Students must acquire relevant skills that companies look for along with their academics. It may involve internships, live projects, industry-based learning, and exposure to existing tools and technologies. Faculty members are good. They help in any situation. They are always ready to help students on or off campus. We have B.Tech and master's courses. Exams are quite challenging, and the evaluation process is tough. Therefore, if anyone is willing to come, please read this carefully regarding the last year, 2023.
detailed_review.Other: I am an average student. I had no choice, so I joined this college. Our course is good. Our college should provide more facilities like Wi-Fi in the hostel, etc. College life is below average. Fests are not very grateful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Silicon University is beyond teaching.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement percentage was 80% in 2023 and 74% in 2024. The highest salary package offered off-campus is 32.6 LPA. The average salary package offered is 9.16 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 3.5 LPA. Core sector placements have shown growth, reaching 19% in 2024. Around 75 core companies participated in 2024. Internship opportunities have risen to 272 in 2024.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has both air-conditioned and non-air-conditioned classrooms with projectors, good ventilation, and lighting. Wi-Fi is available in labs, library, and IICELL (office). The library offers a good pattern of seating arrangement. It has ample books and newspapers. Hostels can accommodate 4 students in each room, with decent facilities. The food is manageable despite occasional issues and separate canteens are available for vegetarian, non-vegetarian, guests, and senior students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers possess in-depth subject knowledge and provide consultation during college hours for doubts. The curriculum is a bit industry-relevant, with opportunities to learn essential skills. Semester exams are tough, requiring 40 out of 100 marks to pass, with no minimum for midterms or teacher assessments.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Silicon University Review.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. Many MNC companies are coming to the campus for the recruitment process, including Infosys, Tech Mahindra, Accenture, Deloitte, and all. Nearly 70 percent of students will surely be placed, but that number varies. In 2021, a good percentage of students were placed, but now, as of the volatile market scenario, the placements are a little affected in 2024-2025.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is not up to the mark. As it's a university, the Bhubaneswar campus seems more like a business school campus than an engineering college campus. The campus could be a little bigger, but the interior, classrooms, and labs are well-equipped, with a little corporate touch. Overall, the experience is good, but it should be a little bigger. Since it's a university now, it doesn't have a good front gate, and there is no proper cricket ground. These are aspects where the university can grow, but you will not feel too bad about the campus as it's small and well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good; mostly, they are supportive. If you are having a doubt, then you can directly go to the faculty member’s chamber and clear your doubts. Most of the faculty members are good. The course curriculum includes all the domain-specific aspects and different core subjects and even includes many soft skill subjects. Labs provide exposure to other important domains like trading or yoga, which can add value to your personal and financial life. To become industry-ready, you have to work on your own by exploring different domains or doing some projects. Silicon also helps, as they charge 5000 after each academic year and provide you a diverse range of domains you can opt for as summer internships. Semester examinations are of a moderate level, but the mark evaluation is very fair and strict.
detailed_review.Other: It’s well-known and has a good reputation in the CSE background. So, if you have a keen interest in CSE, you can definitely choose this college. But overall, your career growth and academic growth depend on you. If you work hard here, you can grab a good opportunity; otherwise, if you're not skilled, no good or bad university can help, and Silicon is a little strict towards its academics.

SNS College of Technology, SNS Group of Institutions provides UG and PG courses in Full Time mode. It provides 46 courses across specialisations such as Aeronautical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Agriculture & Farm Engineering, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning and Automobile Engineering. Some of the courses offered at this institute include B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM and MCA. SNS College of Technology, SNS Group of Institutions fees ranges between INR 35,000 to 2,00,000. The student intake for these courses is 1644. SNS College of Technology, SNS Group of Institutions offers these course across fields such as Engineering, Business & Management Studies and IT & Software. The median salary offered to students is INR 4,18,000. SNS College of Technology, SNS Group of Institutions offers all the campus facilities to students.
